summary: The text discusses the regulations related to aviation search and rescue in Nepal, as outlined in the Aviation Search and Rescue Regulations, 2074. It highlights the responsibilities of the Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal and the establishment of the National Coordination Committee for search and rescue operations. The regulations also mandate the installation of emergency locator transmitters on all aircraft operating in Nepal for safety purposes during emergencies.

summary: The text discusses various legal amendments related to the Development Committee Act of 2013 in Nepal. It includes amendments made in 2013, 2014, 2018, 2020, 2031, 2048, 2066, 2072, and 2075. The amendments focus on strengthening governance, development planning, and the establishment of committees at the provincial level. The text also mentions the transfer of projects from the central government to provincial governments for implementation. Additionally, it highlights the formation and responsibilities of committees as per the respective orders.

summary: The text discusses the regulation of advertisements under the Advertising Regulation Act, 2076 in Nepal. It outlines the rules for the production, distribution, and display of advertisements, as well as the establishment of advertising agencies. The law aims to ensure that advertisements are in compliance with existing laws and serve the public interest. It also defines the roles and responsibilities of advertising agencies in creating and distributing advertising content.

summary: The text discusses the regulations related to advertising in Nepal, as published in the legal documents. It highlights the amendments made to the initial regulations, emphasizing the establishment of a recommendation committee for the selection of qualified candidates for the position of board chairman. The regulations also define terms such as "communication medium" and "social network" in the context of digital media. The document outlines the procedures for advertising and competition in the board selection process.

summary: The text discusses the Financial Intermediary Act 2055, with subsequent amendments, focusing on the regulation of institutions engaged in financial activities. The law aims to improve the financial situation of individuals through small-scale businesses and provides for financial participation in such institutions. The Act has been in effect since Jestha 15, 2065 BS, with amendments made to strengthen and amend certain Nepalese laws. The Act defines financial intermediaries and their registration requirements, aiming to facilitate financial activities for economic development.
